official-title.#text: To establish conditions under which the Secretary of Homeland Security may commence U.S. Customs and Border Protection security screening operations at a preclearance facility outside the United States, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Putting Security First in Preclearance Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (in this Act referred to as the
security screening operations at a preclearance facility outside the United States only in accordance with the requirements of this Act.

quote.#tail: ) may establish conditions under which the

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Putting Security First in Preclearance Act/s:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Homeland Security of the House of Representatives
Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs of the Senate

text.#text: Not later than 90 days before entering into any agreement to commence security screening operations at a preclearance facility under
A notice of intent to commence such security screening operations.
A copy of the proposed agreement that is the subject of such notice of intent.
A comprehensive assessment that includes the following:
A homeland security threat assessment for the country in which such screening operations are proposed.
Information on the anticipated homeland security benefits associated with establishing such facility or commencing such security screening operations.
Information on potential security vulnerabilities associated with commencing such security screening operations, and mitigation plans to address such potential security vulnerabilities.
A U.S. Customs and Border Protection staffing model for such security screening operations and plans for how such positions would be filled.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: officers to carry out such security screening operations.

text.#text: Information about the anticipated impact on border security staffing at United States airports of the deployment of
Information on the anticipated costs over the next five fiscal years associated with commencing such security screening operations.
Information on anticipated funding sources for costs identified in subparagraph (F), including user fee collections.
Information on potential impacts on passengers traveling to the United States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to comprehensively assess the appropriateness of commencing such security screening operations.
security screening positions at a preclearance facility outside the United States may be funded directly or through reimbursement by a foreign government or a foreign person.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3575 IH: Putting Security First in Preclearance Act
